data.title: MONKA SOCCER ACADEMY STAFF
data.text:
Bryan Monka is a born again Christian who believes that all of his abilities are a gift from his Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. Bryan grew up playing soccer in Southern California more specifically in Camarillo, California. He started in AYSO and then moved to playing club soccer with various clubs. Bryan attended Rio Mesa High School where his team won the Channel League and Pacific View League championship. Bryan received awards for All Channel League, All Pacific View League as well as All Ventura County and All CIF during his career. After high school, Bryan went on to play Division I soccer at UC Santa Barbara as well as Liberty University. After Bryan completing his degrees in Business/Economics and Spanish, he was signed by the Southern California Seahorses (USL) which eventually led to a professional contract with the Pittsburgh Riverhounds (USL). Bryan is a USSF B Licensed coach who has 19 years of coaching experience ranging from 3 year olds all the way to the college level. Bryan is currently the Camarillo High School Girls Varsity Soccer Coach.

Currently an MSA FC coach & administrator, Steve has coached soccer for over 25 years. He holds a National USSF license. During his 8 years as Assistant Coach at Ventura College Women's Soccer program the team played in the State Final Four, earned 6 berths to the Southern California Playoffs, & won 7 Conference Championships. Steve coached at the Eagles Soccer Club, assistant coached Real So Cal teams, & coached AYSO. As a Board Member & Tournament Director for both the Eagles Soccer Club & AYSO, Steve has been actively engaged on many levels in community soccer. In 2000, Steve was named as one of the top 5 nominees of thousands of coaches recognized as Cal South "Coach of the Year" receiving an award at a Galaxy game.

At MSA FC, Steve is dedicated to developing the technical ability of aspiring young soccer players to take them to the next level. All three of his children played collegiate soccer, earning scholarships. They all excelled and were recognized with awards for their achievements.

Steve is also currently the President of Life Sports Ministries International, a non-profit organization which supports various programs in the community.

In earlier years, Steve played professional baseball in South America after he played at CSUN where he went to the College World Series. He also played on multiple World Series Championship teams including Colt, Pony, & American Legion and a CIF champion high school team.

Brianna Key is a licensed USSF National coach. She has coached several youth teams in various age groups and has trained youth involved in Olympic Development camps. In collegiate play, Brianna earned a soccer scholarship, was a Pac 10 player, and was named first team Big West Conference Midfielder of the Year. She has been on Olympic Development teams including a National Championship team, and was named to a Women’s National Team. Brianna’s dynamic and impressive college play earned her Player of the Tournament awards all over the Nation. In High School, she was named Ventura County Player of the Year, First Team all CIF, and Rio Mesa MVP multiple years. She helped lead Rio Mesa to four conference championships and a final CIF playoff berth. Brianna’s youth experience included played with Real So Cal, Eagles, and AYSO. Brianna believes quality training and coaching mixed with personal dedication to hard work plays a vital role in the development of a successful soccer player. Brianna is also the current Camarillo High School Girls Varsity Assistant Coach.

Alfonso Rodriguez is a Ventura county native. He's been involved with soccer since he was 4 years old. As a player he played in AYSO , Club soccer, and made his professional debut with Malmö F.F. Through his experiences as a player and as a coach he has developed skilled techniques that have helped train high school athletes, AYSO, and club teams. Alfonso has been coaching in the city of Camarillo for over seven years and has a great rapport within the community. Alfonso is currently the Camarillo High School Girls Soccer Junior Varsity Coach.

Fernando was born in Peru and moved to the US when he was 11 years old. Fernando played AYSO during his youth career and age 17 was given the opportunity to play for the Los Angeles Junior Aztecs (NASL) and travel internationally with the team. Fernando played as a center mid and forward in Germany and Mexico. In Camarillo, Fernando has focused on raising his five children and coaching their soccer teams with national success. Fernando views playing soccer as a lifestyle which extends beyond the pitch and becomes a way of life. He values the character and life skills soccer teaches. Fernando's favorite team is Arsenal.

Mike Gout was born in Los Angeles, raised in Orange County, and moved to Ventura County in 2006 to raise his family. He followed the usual path of AYSO, to AYSO select, to club soccer with Cerritos United. He was lucky enough to have a great coach (his father) for most of his playing career, while having a number of successes at each level. Although he stopped playing competitively shortly after high school, he continued to play in men's and coed leagues for the sheer love of the game.

He started coaching about 10 years ago as a way to introduce his own daughters to the game he loved. Since then he has worked his way through the different age levels of Camarillo AYSO, and was the girls 12U all star coach for multiple seasons. Along the way he's been lucky enough to win some championships and have a lot of fun in the process. He is a licensed CalSouth couch as a 9v9 and 11v11 Grassroots Coach and will be in charge of the MSA FC United 2006 girls team.
